entry.title: Government of Canada recognizes Eagle Urban Transition Centre in supporting First Nations children off-reserve through Jordan's Principle
entry.summary: Working in partnership with First Nations, Indigenous Services Canada is committed to providing children with the supports and services they need, when they need them.

entry.title: Robert Falcon-Ouellette, Member of Parliament for Winnipeg Centre, to highlight success of Eagle Urban Transition Centre in supporting First Nations children in Winnipeg
entry.summary: Please be advised that MP Robert Falcon-Ouellette, on behalf of the Honourable Jane Philpott, Minister of Indigenous Services, will join Grand Chief Arlen Dumas of the Assembly of Manitoba Chiefs to highlight the success of the Eagle Urban Transition Centre in supporting First Nations children living off reserve in Winnipeg.

entry.title: Government of Canada recognizes the National Historic Significance of the Dominion Exhibition Display Building No. 2
entry.summary: Government of Canada recognizes the National Historic Significance of the Dominion Exhibition Display Building No. 2

entry.title: Dominion Exhibition Display Building No. 2, Brandon, Manitoba
entry.summary: Dominion Exhibition Display Building No. 2, Brandon, Manitoba

entry.title: Government of Canada Recognizes the National Historic Significance of Dominion Exhibition Display Building No. 2
entry.summary: Government of Canada Recognizes the National Historic Significance of Dominion Exhibition Display Building No. 2

entry.title: CBSA opens expanded Emerson border crossing
entry.summary: Today, the Honourable Jim Carr, Minister of International Trade Diversification and Member of Parliament for Winnipeg South Centre, on behalf of the Honourable Ralph Goodale, Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness, officially marked the completion of the expansion project at the Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) Emerson port of entry (POE).

entry.title: Official opening for expanded Emerson border crossing
entry.summary: The Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) invites members of the media to the official opening of the expanded Emerson port of entry (POE) on October 12.

entry.title: Governments of Canada and Manitoba strengthen the aerospace industry
entry.summary: Our government is supporting global competitiveness, economic growth and creating good middle-class jobs in the Manitoba aerospace industry. This important industry will expand and create more high quality, well-paying middle jobs, thanks to a $10 million investment.

entry.title: Minister Bains to announce funding for Manitoba’s aerospace industry and participate in fireside chat with Winnipeg business community
entry.summary: The Honourable Navdeep Bains, Minister of Innovation, Science and Economic Development, will announce funding to strengthen Manitoba’s aerospace industry and will participate in a fireside chat hosted by the Winnipeg Chamber of Commerce.

author.name: Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada

entry.title: Canadian astronaut David Saint-Jacques to give virtual presentation to over 1,000 Canadian students
entry.summary: On October 4, 2018, as part of World Space Week, Canadian Space Agency (CSA) astronaut David Saint-Jacques will give a virtual presentation to over 1,000 students from all over Canada.

entry.title: Canada congratulates Sioux Valley Dakota Nation on its latest addition to reserve. New reserve land will support economic growth for the community.
entry.summary: The Government of Canada is proud to work in collaboration with partners to support economic development opportunities and growth in First Nation communities.

author.name: Crown-Indigenous Relations and Northern Affairs Canada

entry.title: Canada congratulates Sioux Valley Dakota Nation on the opening of its new Department of Families
entry.summary: The federal government is committed to working in partnership with First Nations and all levels of government to support the health and well-being of First Nation children and families.

entry.title: Sioux Valley Dakota Nation, Canada and Manitoba sign Framework Agreement on Reconciliation
entry.summary: The governments of Sioux Valley Dakota Nation, Canada and Manitoba are working together to advance reconciliation of outstanding issues for the benefit of the citizens of Sioux Valley Dakota Nation and all Canadians.

author.name: Crown-Indigenous Relations and Northern Affairs Canada

entry.title: Manitoba Metis Federation and Government of Canada announce joint action plan on Advancing Reconciliation
entry.summary: The Government of Canada is committed to working on a nation-to-nation, government-to-government basis with the Métis Nation to advance reconciliation and renew the relationship through co-operation, respect for Métis rights, and ending the status quo.

author.name: Crown-Indigenous Relations and Northern Affairs Canada

entry.title: Parliamentary Secretary Dan Vandal to highlight improvements in early learning and child care for Metis children during Manitoba Metis Federation Annual General Assembly in Winnipeg
entry.summary: Dan Vandal, Parliamentary Secretary to the Minister of Indigenous Services, will elaborate on how the Government of Canada and Metis Nation are working together to provide Indigenous children with the best possible start in life.

entry.title: Minister Bennett and MMF President Chartrand to make reconciliation announcement at the Manitoba Metis Federation’s 2018 Annual General Assembly
entry.summary: Minister Bennett and MMF President Chartrand to make reconciliation announcement at the Manitoba Metis Federation’s 2018 Annual General Assembly

author.name: Crown-Indigenous Relations and Northern Affairs Canada

entry.title: Minister Bennett to make an announcement on advancements in reconciliation and renewed relationships with Sioux Valley Dakota Nation
entry.summary: The Honourable Carolyn Bennett, Minister of Crown-Indigenous Relations, will visit Sioux Valley Dakota Nation to highlight the signing of a Reconciliation Framework Agreement

author.name: Crown-Indigenous Relations and Northern Affairs Canada

entry.title: Backgrounder: Winnipeg drivers to enjoy safer more efficient roadways
entry.summary: The governments of Canada, Manitoba and Winnipeg are providing $315.9 million funding for improvements to 49 sections of Winnipeg’s road network.

entry.title: Winnipeg drivers to enjoy safer more efficient roadways
entry.summary: Ensuring regional roads are safe and well-maintained is crucial to economic growth, facilitating trade and creating well-paid middle-class jobs.

entry.title: Government of Canada announces support for acquisition and repair of Churchill rail line by Arctic Gateway Group
entry.summary: Government of Canada announces historic public private partnership with First Nations, communties, and business to repair Northern Manitoba rail line to Churchill.

entry.title: New Owners for Hudson Bay Rail Line
entry.summary: Government of Canada announces historic public private partnership with First Nations, communties, and business to repair Northern Manitoba rail line to Churchill.

entry.title: Minister Carr announces an historic partnership in northern Manitoba
entry.summary: Members of the media are invited to attend an important event with the Honourable Jim Carr, Minister of International Trade Diversification on behalf of the Honourable Navdeep Bains, Minister of Innovation, Science and Economic Development and Minister responsible for Western Economic Diversification Canada, on an historic partnership in northern Manitoba.

entry.title: Media Advisory - Winnipeg, Manitoba
entry.summary: Members of the media are invited to attend an important infrastructure event with Dan Vandal, Member of Parliament for Saint Boniface–Saint Vital, on behalf of the Honourable François-Philippe Champagne, Minister of Infrastructure and Communities; the Honourable Jeff Wharton, Minister of Municipal Relations; and His Worship Brian Bowman, Mayor of Winnipeg.

entry.title: Lynn Lake Gold Project — Participant Funding Allocated
entry.summary: The Canadian Environmental Assessment Agency (the Agency) has allocated $331,360.50 in federal funds to seven recipients to assist their participation in the environmental assessment of the proposed Lynn Lake Gold Project, located 1,000 kilometres north of Winnipeg, Manitoba.

entry.title: Towards a Western Canada Growth Strategy
entry.summary: Minister Bains launches engagement to help shape the Western Canada Growth Strategy. Strategy aims to create jobs and grow the economy by building on Western Canada’s unique strengths and competitive advantages, and directing the federal $208 million commitment from Budget 2018 where it will be most effective.

entry.title: Norway House Cree Nation receives $100 million commitment from Government of Canada to build Health Centre of Excellence
entry.summary: The Government of Canada is working in partnership with First Nations to improve health outcomes and access to health services for First Nations through health transformation investments.

entry.title: Government of Canada investing nearly $68 million over three years to support First Nations-led health transformation
entry.summary: The Government of Canada is taking major steps to improve health outcomes and access to health services for First Nations through health transformation investments in First Nation communities across Canada.

entry.title: Southeast Collegiate celebrates grand opening of their new state-of-the-art school facility in Winnipeg
entry.summary: The Government of Canada is working in partnership with First Nations to ensure that First Nations children and youth have the tools they need to succeed and maintain a strong connection to their culture and identity.

entry.title: Minister Philpott to announce significant investments to support health programs and services in Norway House Cree Nation
entry.summary: Please be advised that the Honourable Jane Philpott, Minister of Indigenous Services, will join Chief Larson Anderson of Norway House Cree Nation, to announce significant funding in support of Indigenous and community-based health services for Norway House Cree Nation.

entry.title: Minister Philpott to visit Winnipeg and make announcements regarding First Nations education and health transformation
entry.summary: Winnipeg, Manitoba - Please be advised that the Honourable Jane Philpott, Minister of Indigenous Services will be in Winnipeg on Thursday, September 6, 2018, and will participate in two announcements.

entry.title: Repairs to Begin Immediately on Northern Manitoba Rail
entry.summary: Today, the Honourable Jim Carr, Minister of International Trade Diversification, on behalf of the Honourable Navdeep Bains, Minister of Innovation, Science and Economic Development and Minister responsible for Western Economic Diversification Canada, announced that the Arctic Gateway Group Limited Partnership has purchased the Hudson Bay Rail Company, the Hudson Bay Port Company and the Churchill Marine Tank Farm from OmniTRAX Inc.

entry.title: Government of Canada Supports Hemp Industry
entry.summary: Minister of Agriculture and Agri-Food, Lawrence MacAulay, will be at Manitoba Harvest Hemp Foods in Winnipeg to announce an investment supporting risk management for the hemp industry and to highlight the implications of the cannabis legislation on industry regulations.

entry.title: End of lockdown and search at Stony Mountain institution – Medium Security Unit and Maximum Security Unit
entry.summary: The lockdown put in place at the medium security unit and maximum security unit at Stony Mountain Institution on August 16, 2018 has ended and a general search has been completed. The institution has resumed its normal operations.

entry.title: Canada congratulates Pauingassi First Nation on official opening of expanded water treatment plant and other water infrastructure progress
entry.summary: Today, the Honourable Jane Philpott, Minister of Indigenous Services, congratulated Pauingassi First Nation as they celebrated recent upgrades to their water treatment plant with an official opening, and the additional progress being made on water infrastructure.

entry.title: Lake Manitoba and Lake St. Martin Outlet Channels Project — Participant Funding Available
entry.summary: The Canadian Environmental Assessment Agency (the Agency) is making funding available through its Participant Funding Program to assist the participation of the public and Indigenous groups in the federal environmental assessment of the proposed Lake Manitoba and Lake St. Martin Outlet Channels Project, located in the Interlake region of Manitoba.

entry.title: Members of Lake St. Martin First Nation continue return to rebuilt community with completion of 190 homes
entry.summary: Canada, Manitoba, and Lake St. Martin First Nation are working together to bring home residents displaced by severe flooding in 2011.

entry.title: Governments Invest in Beef and Forage Research to Support Growth in Manitoba's Livestock Sector
entry.summary: The Canada and Manitoba governments are investing $2.85 million over the next five years at the Manitoba Beef and Forage Institute (MBFI) in Brandon, supporting the sustainable growth of the livestock sector, Federal Agriculture Minister Lawrence MacAulay and Manitoba Agriculture Minister Ralph Eichler announced today.

entry.title: Warning about Red River water levels
entry.summary: Public Services and Procurement Canada wishes to advise the public that, as a result of very dry weather this year, water levels along the Red River (between St. Andrews Lock and Dam and the city of Winnipeg, including the Assiniboine River) are forecasted to fall below the normal summer operational levels.

entry.title: Margaret Laurence (1926-1987)
entry.summary: Well known and widely read, Margaret Laurence is one of Canada’s most esteemed and beloved writers.

entry.title: Government of Canada Honours National Historic Significance of Margaret Laurence (1926-1987)
entry.summary: Today, Dr. Richard Wishart, Manitoba Member of the Historic Sites and Monuments Board of Canada commemorated the national historic significance of Margaret Laurence with a special ceremony to unveil a plaque at the Margaret Laurence House in Neepawa, Manitoba.

entry.title: Manitoba’s 2018‒19 federal Gas Tax Fund allocations
entry.summary: The Government of Canada has delivered the first of two annual $36-million federal Gas Tax Fund (GTF) instalments to Manitoba

entry.title: Building stronger communities across Manitoba with federal Gas Tax Fund
entry.summary: First of two annual funding transfers now available for more than 135 communities across the province

entry.title: Government of Canada Recognizes the National Historic Significance of Margaret Laurence (1926-1987)
entry.summary: Representatives from Parks Canada and the Historic Sites and Monuments Board of Canada will take part in a plaque unveiling ceremony to commemorate Margaret Laurence (1926-1987) as a national historic person.

entry.title: Governments highlight funded activities for research and industry service providers in Manitoba under the Canadian Agricultural Partnership
entry.summary: Researchers and industry service providers are now able to access funding for activities under the Ag Action Manitoba program as the Canadian Agricultural Partnership continues to be implemented, Federal Agriculture Minister Lawrence MacAulay and Manitoba Agriculture Minister Ralph Eichler announced today.
